intro: Pycnostachys graminifolia, commonly known as the grass-leaved pycnostachys, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
